content.description: If you think you are solid with 5.10 cracks, try this one. A real"Jimmie 10d". It has not been done many times and could be a bit dirty, but what an awesome looking line.
content.protection: Cams and more cams up to 5"  or so
content.location: On the left side of the cliff is pretty obvious hand to fist corner and roof.

climbs.name: Looking for Goldilocks
climbs.fa: Rich Baker, Mark Wilson, Andy Ross 1987

content.description: The beautiful left-facing corner just left of SHORT BUT SWEET. Climb the slab to a flexy piton, pull over the roof cruxfully, then follow finger a crack with some tricky gear to  a crux gaining a beautifully splitter hand crack higher up.
content.protection: Piton, normal rack to 3 inches. a screamer for piton
content.location: Main Cliff just left of SHORT BUT SWEET

content.description: This is the largest section of cliff at Found Ledge. It is about 600' wide and broken up by cracks and chimneys. Most people will come to this section first when approaching.
